text: The United States Secretary of Veterans Affairs is the head of the United States Department of Veterans Affairs, the department in charge of taking care of the affairs of war veterans. The Secretary is a member of the Cabinet and second to last at 17th in the line of succession to the presidency (the position was last until the United States Department of Homeland Security was added in 2006Public Law 109-177§.503). To date, all appointees and acting appointees to the post have been United States military veterans, but that is not a requirement to fill the position. When the position of Secretary is vacant, the United States Deputy Secretary of Veterans Affairs.
